title: Extractions of Diverse Structural Information from vEM Data with CLEM and Deep Learning Workflows to Understand Brain Function
content: Volume electron microscopy (vEM) as a technique has gained popularity in recent years. Based on the efforts of a growing international community, researchers have easier access to the latest information for improving imaging platforms, sample preparation methods, and image analysis workflows [1]. Additionally, the introduction of deep leaning (DL) algorithms for image analysis provided options for end-users to handle large vEM datasets in a reasonable time frame, especially since some software such as Dragonfly, Amira, or Microscopy Image Browser (MIB) integrated DL models into their software user interface.
